bibl.title: In Re: Ex Parte - Turner Jackson Petitioner For A Writ of Habeas Corpus
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image.

msIdentifier.repository: National Archives and Records Administration, Seattle Branch, Washington
msIdentifier.collection: RG 21 US District Court Western Division of Washington, Seattle

div1.p:
In the United States Cirtuit Court for Western District of the State of Washington, Northern Division.
In re. Turner Jackson, petitioner. Order Reducing Bond

The above entitled matter coming on to be heard on this 29th day of September, A.D. 1905. upon the petition of Turner Jackson herein, praying that the bond heretofore or- dered by this Court to be given for the detention of the said Turner Jackson in the United States penitentiary at McNeil's Island, pending in the United States Government from the order of discharge made, rendered and entered in this court on the 12th day of September, A.D. 1905, and it fully appearing to this Court that he penalty required in said bond should reduced upon the facts set forth in the petition of said Turner Jackson;

Now, then, it is hereby ordered, that the said Turner Jackson may be and shall be at large pending said appeal upon executing a recognizance in the sum or three Thousand dollars to the satisfaction of the Clerk of this court for his appearance to answer the judgement of the United States Circuit Court of Appeals for the Ninth Judicial Court,
C.H. Hanford, Judge.
